question: 心願
sourceMnemonic:
The thing your <kanji>heart</kanji> <kanji>request</kanji>s is what your heart wants. This is your <vocabulary>heartfelt desire</vocabulary>.

<ja>心願</ja> is often found in the phrase <ja>心願成就</ja> (fulfillment of a heartfelt wish), commonly used in the context of prayer rituals at Shinto shrines or Buddhist temples.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
